page.title: 13Horse Trainer Lound (part 2)
page.content: Each horse has its own stable which is cleaned out three times every day. The horses are groomed every day and are clipped 7 times a year. The saddles and bridles and other tack is also cleaned regularly. The horses are fed on hay, oats, bran, sugar beet pulp, vitamins and minerals. The diet varies from horse to horse. Young horses are exercised for l hour a day and older horses for 4 hours a day. They are never ridden bare back. Mr. Wright takes them hunting to get them used to other horses. He also takes them to the disused gravel pits where they can get used to water. They are also taken for hacks and sometimes go jumping. The horses are very valuable when they are trained. He does not train horses for other people.
